p: After 48 h at 30 Â°C, the inhibition zone around an EO-impregnated paper disc was about 30 mm ( Figure 1a), i.e., three-fold larger compared to that around a commercial nystatin-impregnated paper disc ( Figure 1b). Besides, the density of the Candida parapsilosis lawn in a plate containing EO was lower than in the plate with nystatin, indicating the suppressing effect of EO vapors on C. parapsilosis growth.
